page.title: 03Weston Lullingfield School
page.content: The first school was founded in 1836 with money provided under the 1709 will of Miss Eleanor Harris of Boreatton Hall, Baschurch. It is now a private house. The present school was built by the Harris Trust at Weston Common in the 1870'S. It was enlarged in l894 to accommodate 70 children and 2 teachers. The school now has 33 children with 2 teachers. The Harris Trust still helps the school with the purchase of large items of equipment. Children go on to the Corbet Comprehensive School, Baschurch at the age of 11. There is an active Sports Association of neighbouring primary schools with whom the children compete in Football, Rounders, Unihoc, Athletics, Swimming, Netball, Cross-country, Cricket.
